title: FSIS Issues Public Health Alert For Imported Veal Products Due To Possible Non-O157 Shiga toxin producing E. coli (STEC) O103 Contamination
summary: WASHINGTON, May 16, 2017 The U.S. Department of Agriculture's Food Safety and Inspection Service (FSIS) is issuing a Public Health Alert to inform consumers that approximately 424 pounds of raw veal products imported from the Netherlands may be contaminated with Non-O157 Shiga toxin-producing Escherichia coli...
impacted_products: Boxes of chilled Boneless Veal Cap with case code of Londbos05597422 and lot code 0001.
Boxes of chilled Boneless Veal BHS with case code of Londbos05597426 and lot code 0005.
Boxes of chilled Boneless Veal Inside with case code of Londbos05597439 and lot code 0006.
Boxes of chilled Boned In Veal Rack Chop with case code of SELEDEL05593535 and lot code 0012.
